column2: Please share cv at sr.exehr@aimlay.com or call at  9667991209. Responsibilities: Market Research and Identification: Conduct thorough market research to identify potential universities and colleges for collaboration based on strategic fit, academic offerings, and target audience. Stay updated on industry trends, educational policies, and market demands to anticipate opportunities for new partnerships. Relationship Building: Establish and nurture relationships with key decision-makers, faculty, and administrators within targeted universities and colleges. Initiate and maintain regular communication to understand their needs, objectives, and expectations. Collaboration Proposals: Develop compelling collaboration proposals tailored to the needs of each institution, showcasing the mutual benefits and value proposition of partnership. Present partnership opportunities in a clear and persuasive manner, addressing inquiries and concerns effectively. Negotiation and Agreement: Lead negotiations to finalize terms, agreements, and contractual details with prospective university and college partners. Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to ensure all agreements adhere to organizational guidelines and legal requirements. Project Management: Work cross-functionally with internal teams to ensure successful execution of collaborative projects, ensuring alignment with objectives and deadlines. Monitor and report on the progress of partnerships, identifying potential bottlenecks and implementing solutions. Networking and Representing the Organization: Represent the organization at industry events, conferences, and seminars to build a strong presence and expand the network of potential partners. Leverage professional networks and affiliations to discover new collaboration opportunities. Feedback and Improvement: Collect feedback from partnered institutions to assess the effectiveness of collaborations and identify areas for improvement. Utilize feedback to enhance partnership strategies and ensure long-term success. Market Intelligence: Analyze competitor activities and market trends related to university and college collaborations, providing insights to enhance our approach. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Education, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus. Proven track record of successfully establishing partnerships in the education sector or related industry. Strong negotiation, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines. Experience in project management and cross-functional collaboration. Willingness to travel as needed for meetings, presentations, and networking events

column2: Aviva Life Insurance Company India Limited is looking for Senior Manager / AVP ( Fellow ) to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey           Senior Management Responsibilities:    As a Senior Manager or Assistant Vice President (AVP), you would likely have significant managerial responsibilities. This may include overseeing teams, setting strategic objectives, and ensuring operational efficiency within your department or area of expertise.                Strategic Planning:    You would be involved in strategic planning processes, contributing insights and expertise to help shape the organization's long-term goals and objectives. This could involve market analysis, identifying growth opportunities, and developing strategies to enhance competitiveness.                Leadership and Mentorship:    In your role as a Senior Manager or AVP, you would provide leadership and guidance to your team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence. You may also mentor junior staff members, helping to develop their skills and advance their careers.                Project Management:    You would likely be involved in overseeing key projects or initiatives within your department or across the organization. This could involve managing budgets, timelines, and resources to ensure successful project delivery.                Stakeholder Engagement:    As a senior leader, you would interact with various internal and external stakeholders, including senior executives, clients, partners, and regulatory bodies. Building and maintaining positive relationships with these stakeholders is crucial for the success of your role and the organization as a whole.                Subject Matter Expertise (Fellowship):    The addition of "Fellow" to your title suggests that you may hold a fellowship or advanced certification in a specific field or industry. This signifies expertise and credibility in your area of specialization, which you would leverage to provide strategic guidance and insights within the organization.
column11: project management, data analysis, team management, MIS, strategy

column2: Job Title:Contracting Lawyer Career Level:7 Manager Workforce:Corporate Functions  Skill Track:Legal Specialty:Sales & Delivery Contracting  Recruiting Contact:Jatin Gupta Contracting Legal Professionals (CLP) in Accenture's Corporate Functions organization coordinate and deliver legal, contract and commercial counsel in support of Accenture's business. CLPs identify and help manage and mitigate risk and ensure ethical behavior and compliance with laws and company policies, while providing guidance and negotiating contracts leveraging commercial and market relevant positions. Job  Summary : Review, draft, and negotiate several types of contractual agreements in a fast-paced corporate environment which may include:master services agreements, outsourcing agreements, statements of work, service level agreements, licensing agreements, SaaS agreements, data transfer agreements, requests for proposals and agreements involving cloud, blockchain security, automation, systems integration and agile development. Independently support transactions and based on requirement also team-up with senior CLPs in supporting complex contracts and deal structures. Act, and continuously evolve as, a knowledgeable and relevant advisor on legal and commercial risks associated with transactions. Key Responsibilities: Independently, and help to, structure, negotiate and close client transactions to be most advantageous from a legal and business perspective Strategize with senior CLPs and internal business clients prior to client negotiations Stay abreast of developments affecting the company, its clients, and industries and synthesize the information to incorporate it into company's transactional practices Educate and advise company executives with respect to legal and risk management issues Develop subject matter expertise in one of more areas that benefit Legal and/or our business Participate in developing internal guidelines, toolkits, and packaged knowledge capital on various legal and business issues Support, promote and implement Legal Group initiatives Embrace and evolve to gain expertise in seven Contracting attributes, including becoming a pathfinder, architect, business-minded, nonconformist, inspired, relevant and technology enabled contracting professional. Relationships: Reports to:Contracting Lead Supervises:No direct supervisory responsibility External Relationships:Accenture client executives and negotiating teams; Outside Counsel Knowledge and Skill Requirements: Accomplished negotiator with an understanding of principle-based negotiation strategy and tactics including the ability to present alternatives with proposed solutions Proven ability to efficiently manage a large volume of transactions independently Experience negotiating and drafting technology-based agreements Understand basic principles of Finance, Accounting, Marketing, and Management Strong executive presence Good understanding of contracting/risk issues, including IP, as they apply to digital, consulting, systems integration, and outsourcing transactions Excellent oral and written communication skills Additional Desirable Criteria: Work Requirements: Travel required. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Qualification Qualifications: JD (or equivalent) Authorized and licensed to practice law in India Minimum 10-11 years of transactional experience in digital, consulting, systems integration, and/or outsourcing areas in roles with increasing responsibility, such experience should be in a law firm or in a fast-paced corporate legal/transaction group in a relevant industry Minimum of 3 years of experience negotiating Intellectual Property and Data Privacy issues preferred

column2: Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to join our  Central fuel Desk (CFD ) team as Power professional at corporate office, Ludhiana, having more then 12+ years of experience in Power sector. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in supporting our power management, Project financial Modelling, IRR, project viability, Solar project management and contributing to the successful execution of solar rooftop, Long term Group Captive projects, Various sustainability initiatives under scope1, 2 &3 etc. ?The candidate should possess a strong foundation in power management, Project execution, financial modelling of solar projects, solar rooftop project EPC. And having knowledge of Carbon/REC/ESCerts/Power Trading market, landed sheet calculation, power purchase agreements (PPA), project operations and deep regulatory knowledge of Power sector. Well aware of Indian Power regulatory matters from end user prospective. Roles and Responsibilities: Solar Rooftop Project EPC: lead  Central fuel Desk (CFD ) from corporate office regarding planning and execution of solar rooftop projects from inception to completion. Assist in coordinating with engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) teams to ensure project timelines and quality standards are met. Contribute to the identification and mitigation of project risks. Operation of Project: Collaborate with operations teams to ensure the smooth functioning of solar projects. Project viability: ?Candidate should have experience of IRR, financial Modelling of a solar, wind or hybrid power projects. Energy efficiency Project: ?Candidate should have knowledge of energy efficiency initiatives and related projects and execution. ? Power management: Monitor energy markets, REC/ESCerts Trading, Carbon trading and analyse trends to support decision-making in power trading activities. Assist in developing and implementing trading strategies to optimize energy portfolio performance. Collaborate with senior team members to execute power transactions and manage associated risks  Landed Sheet Calculation: Perform detailed landed cost calculations for solar projects, considering factors such as equipment costs, installation expenses, and operational expenses. Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to ensure accuracy and completeness of landed cost assessments. Power Purchase Agreement (PPA): Assist in the negotiation and drafting of power purchase agreements with relevant stakeholders. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and company standards in all aspects of PPAs. Monitor and evaluate PPA performance against agreed-upon terms. Knowledge of Sustainability reporting and Scope1, 2 & 3 Reduction: Assist sustainability Team for calculation of Scope 1&2 in order to reduce carbon emission of group company. Assist sustainability team for making various sustainability reporting at group level as per the external stockholder requirement. Assist Management in reduction of carbon emission specially from scope-2 under GRI standard

A summary of the employee requirements are listed below. See the policy for full information (link to policy is highlighted below). Employees must meet the requirements for the position, including the minimum and/or basic qualifications and performance requirements.  Employees are expected to be in their current position for a minimum of 12 months before applying to a new position. If considering a cross-border position, please pay particular attention to the visa and/or work permit requirements. In most cases, employees must already possess the appropriate work authorization for the country where the position is located. Employees participating in a group program for temporary international transfers, including those in the Global Careers Program (GCP), who are interested in applying to a posted internal position outside of their home location, need to comply with Policy 750 International Temporary Transfers for Groups (link to policy is highlighted below). Accenture will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Accenture encourages applicants of all ages." column2: Greetings from AMS! We have a great opportunity with a  reputed  and  listed  conglomerate organization! Qualification:  Full Time Graduate/ LLB  Roles and Responsibilities :   ??Serve on the CA team to lead government-related initiatives that impact the interest in  business assigned to this position.  ??Work with the business leaders to lead and coordinate policy priorities pertaining to business in  Maharashtra  ??Develop policy positions, support thought leadership materials on CA issues that enhance the  businesses position in the market.  ??Develop and lead advocacy on priority issues and engage leadership on public policy/regulatory  advocacy efforts  ??Engage with government officials and other relevant external stakeholders, at all appropriate  levels, to enhance their understanding of the products, services and positions and promote  policies which enhance and protect the products and services.  ??Participate in industry association meetings in close coordination with General Manager  CA &  Group President  CA and drive business activity on priority issues.  ??Develop strategic priorities with business leaders by participating in business operating processes  such as financial planning, product development and strategy development.  ??Work with legal counsel and business leaders to secure regulatory approvals needed to execute  the commercial priorities.  ??Keep a close watch on impending changes in pertinent legislation/regulation and or government  incentive schemes   ??Help the businesses, and secure government support (e.g. financial incentives, pending dues) that  helps in meeting the business goals  ??Develop business engagement and partnerships with internal stakeholders and support functions  to drive business outcomes and continuous improvement in the Corporate Affairs function.  Basic Qualifications:  ??Bachelors degree and advanced business, technical, or law degree.  ??Ideally, 7-12 years of government relations experience with government, corporation and/or  consulting focused on legislative and regulatory arenas  ??Significant experience working with government and key stakeholders in shaping policies to  achieve positive business outcomes and a demonstrated track record of success in those  engagements.  ??Broad understanding of public policy making and legislative processes at state and national level  and ability to identify and engage key decision makers within government  ??Ability to work through complex issues to quickly identify most priority and focus areas  ??Experience working with complex organizations to map out key decision makers / stakeholders ??Proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint  ??Fluency in spoken and written Marathi, Hindi and English  Leadership Behaviour and Competencies:  ??Self-motivated, dedicated team player with a proactive approach in managing and seeking to  continuously improve the function  ??Demonstrated strategic thinking, including proven ability to prioritize, balance, and meet  conflicting demands from multiple business entities in a fast-paced environment.  ??Commitment to conducting the business affairs with the highest integrity, including strict  adherence to applicable laws and the values, which often go beyond legal compliance.  ??Forward thinking and proactive on legislative, regulatory and public policy issues  ??Thoughtful and execution-minded with the ability to offer actionable opinions  ??Effective at creating a consensus around strategic initiatives utilizing a collaborative engaging  decision-making process  ??Sensitive to political and cultural issue  Email: pritesh.barve@weareams.com

column2: We are seeking an experienced and dedicated Manager - Government Liaisoning to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in working with various state authorities such as the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC), Pollution Control Board, and other regulatory bodies. The primary responsibility of this role is to manage and maintain effective relationships with government agencies to ensure smooth business operations and compliance with all relevant regulations. Key Responsibilities: Act as the primary point of contact between the company and state authorities, including MIDC, Pollution Control Board, and other regulatory bodies. Ensure compliance with all government regulations and obtain necessary approvals and clearances for various projects. Develop and implement strategies to effectively manage government relations and enhance the company's reputation with regulatory agencies. Monitor and analyze legislative and regulatory developments that may impact the company and provide timely updates to senior management. Coordinate with internal departments to gather necessary information and documentation required for government submissions and compliance. Represent the company at government meetings, public hearings, and industry events to advocate for the company's interests. Maintain accurate records of all interactions and communications with government officials and regulatory bodies. Prepare and submit necessary reports, applications, and documentation to government agencies in a timely and accurate manner. Address and resolve any issues or concerns raised by government authorities promptly and effectively. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Public Administration, Political Science, Law, Business Administration, or a related field. A master?? degree is preferred. Minimum of 10+ years of experience in government liaisoning, with a proven track record of working with MIDC, Pollution Control Board, and other state authorities. In-depth knowledge of government regulations, policies, and procedures related to industrial development and environmental compliance. Strong networking and relationship-building skills with government officials and regulatory bodies. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software applications. Willingness to travel as required.
column11: Government Liaison, Liaison, Government Relations, Pollution Control, MIDC, Government Affairs, Environment, Government Liasoning, Approvals
